Articles.Content:
I figured I would at least pop by and stop lurking and actually say hello.

My friend told me about the game while I was in the process of looking for something interesting to play. Needless to say, after a few hours on the demo I was hooked and have been building objects to throw into space. Even on a video game there is a drive to explore more and go further!!!!

So, with that, hello everyone and I look forward to chatting in the near future.

Hello and welcome to the forums!Remember,everything can be solved with MORE SRB! (Solid Rocket Boosters),and in the rare case that boosters don't solve your problem, you can check out the "How To" section for help.

I believe you'll find the actual wording is MOAR BOOSTERS. But close enough.

But welcome to the forum, we are a friendly bunch, so don't worry about asking any questions.

Oddly enough I have already found that out my self.

How can I solve (insert problem)? Throw a couple boosters at it and see what happens!!!

One of us! One of us!...

Yep, MOAR BOOSTERS and MOAR STRUTS is usually the answer to kerbal engineering problems, usually with hilarious results.

Welcome to the forum.

Welcome to the forums!

"MOAR BOOSTERS / STRUTS" silliness aside, there are a number of useful player aids out there to help you get the most out of your spaceships through intelligent design and piloting. I've tried to include some of the better ones out there in the Drawing Board (link in my sig). Don't be afraid to ask any questions you might have about building and flying rockets in the How To section, either.

Happy landings!
